overview:
Geoff Smith was born in December 1972 and is an independent artist based out of Nashville TN. His massively catchy power pop styles are reminiscent of the Beatles, Ben Folds and Squeeze.

Geoff began composing jingles and theme songs for podcasters back in 2005 and has written hundreds and hundreds and the list keeps growing.

Most of you probably know Geoff from his jingles heard on Adam Curryâ€™s Daily Source Code Podcast, GeekBrief.tv, Radio Lingua Network, Tips from The Top Floor, ScreenCasts Online and the successful iYule project. Themes and jingles for podcasts includes:

Pod Save The Queen, Heterosexual Moment on Pacific Coast Hellway, My Marilyn, Pete and Reneâ€™s Happy Hour, The Go Daddy Commercial for DSC, Zee and Zedâ€™s Shopping at Target, and he is currently working with several podcasters with their themes and jingles.
